Text.Value: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*
By the living gods, I believe you.
Unleash the wyrm, let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. And may they be driven forever from the Coast.
The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.
What darkness has fallen upon us.
A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.
The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
I once carried it, but it was stolen from me. Find it, let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see your home burn to ash.
He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened - but just the once.
Do you know what these lessons are?
How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
I should go. I know of still others that might help us when the battle horns call.
With him gone and the city near ruin, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you and Wyll.
No. But I know only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. I thought only Ulder could succeed. With his death, the duty falls to his son.
The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.
Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.
The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.
This city holds no place for you - or for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

Text.Value: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please - take him this message.
Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I should seek Wyll out and give him a message.
We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.
Let it set the path before you. Or do not, and see Baldur's Gate burn to ash.
Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.
A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.
Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.
The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.
Have courage. May we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.
The dragon Ansur is dead.
My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!
Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

EditorData.logicalname: Skill_Persuasion, was in IRN broken pact

Text.Value: Wyll was schooled in the ways of the great champions. He is to use those lessons to wake the wyrm sleeping beneath Baldur's Gate. The wyrm is oathbound to answer the call and come to the city's aid.
The fate of the city now rests with us.
You are either a fool for trusting him - or a wretch for conspiring with him. It doesn't matter which.
When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?
Probe Florrick's mind.
A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.
EditorData.NodeContext: Include Florrick Spitting before saying line.

Text.Value: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
*Your thoughts come up short.*
The city has faced countless threats. But Ravengard knew it could not survive the Absolute's slaughter.
That warrior was Ravengard. If you prize his ways, you'll help Wyll seek out the wyrm.
Your faith is well-founded. I will take your message to Wyll.
Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.
A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.
Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

EditorData.stateContext: Florrick and company in attack position

Text.Value: Godsdamned hypocrites.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Chris] *REUSE* [Florrick and Allies] use anims from FlorrickFightFallback.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

Text.Value: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.
Lady Mizora told me everything. How Wyll slaughtered his own father, how he craves his power.

EditorData.stateContext: Florrick and her companions are at ease

Text.Value: At ease.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

Text.Value: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.
He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
There's something you must know. I should've told Wyll sooner, but I'd hoped somehow Ravengard would return to us.

Synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died. Wyll is not present.
